title: Ukraine’s Allies Promise Weapons for Spring Counteroffensive
description: Ukraine and Russia are both running low on ammunition, and both are scrambling to replenish their stocks and gain a competitive edge.

title: The U.S. says it won’t stop surveillance flights despite the downing of its drone in the Black Sea.
Your Thursday Briefing: Bank Fears Resurface
description: Also, South Korea’s leader visits Japan and Russia gears up for more cyberattacks.

title: After South Korea’s Icebreaker, Its President Is Welcomed to Tokyo
description: The first such visit to Japan by a South Korean president in 12 years is a tangible step toward thawing relations, but both leaders face challenges.

title: Sunflower Sea Stars Are Set to Get Protection Under the Endangered Species Act
description: Sunflower sea stars, hit by a “climate-fueled pandemic,” play a key role in keeping marine ecosystems balanced.

title: French Protesters Rally in Last Angry Push Before Pension Bill Vote
description: Many believe the legislation to raise the retirement age to 64 from 62 will pass Parliament, and they are looking beyond the vote to fight on.

title: Blinken Calls for ‘Accountability’ on War Crimes in Ethiopia
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken walked a careful line during a visit to Ethiopia as the Biden administration reassesses relations with the prime minister, Abiy Ahmed.

title: Why the Black Sea Is a Flashpoint Between Russia and the West
description: It has long been a theater of competition between Russia and the West, a dynamic supercharged by the Ukraine war.

title: Russia’s Spring Offensive in Ukraine Could Include Cyberattacks, Microsoft Says
description: Moscow also appears to be stepping up influence operations to weaken European and U.S. support for sending more aid to the Ukrainian government.

title: Teachers Join Wave of Public Service Strikes as U.K. Unveils Budget
description: A two-day strike by educators in England coincided with walkouts by doctors and transit staff. And it began on the day that the government detailed its new budget.

title: Israel Says It Killed a Bomber Who Probably Entered From Lebanon
description: Officials said that the man was behind a roadside blast in northern Israel, most likely after having crossed the border secretly, in a rare incident along the frontier.

title: When a Military Spies on Citizens’ Phones
description: How the Mexican military is using private data against civilians — and what that reveals about the country’s democracy.

title: Scientists Investigate a Bird Flu Outbreak in Seals
description: Wild birds passed the virus to seals in New England at least twice last summer, a new study suggests.

title: Tell Us Your Pandemic ‘Silver Lining’
description: It has been a traumatic three years. But some good things came out of the upheaval, too.

title: A Hungarian Town Seethes Over a Giant Chinese Battery Plant
description: A $7.8 billion factory planned by a Chinese company in eastern Hungary has become divisive even within the party of Prime Minister Viktor Orban, who championed it.

title: A YouTuber in Japan Turned His Parliament Post Into a Side Hustle
description: The upper house of Japan’s Parliament almost unanimously voted to expel an eccentric YouTuber who won a seat last year. The reason: He never showed up for work.

title: U.S. Drone Downed over the Black Sea: What We Know
description: The incident was the first known physical contact between the Russian and American militaries since the war in Ukraine began.

title: Downing of U.S. Drone Raises Tensions With Russia
description: Russian jets’ encounter with an American surveillance drone on Tuesday was the first known physical contact between the two militaries since the war in Ukraine began. Here’s what we are covering:

title: Ukraine’s allies are set to discuss the dwindling ammunition supply.
A 1,600-Year-Old Coffin May Shed Light on Roman Britain
description: A lead-lined coffin that was discovered in northern England could offer clues about the area’s transition from the Roman Empire to its Anglo-Saxon period.

title: What Is the MQ-9 Reaper Drone?
description: The unmanned aircraft that was downed in the Black Sea is used both for surveillance and for targeted attacks.

title: Putin claims the West is trying to ‘pull apart’ Russia.
In Budget Speech, U.K. Government Will Issue a Call to Work
description: In a major policy speech, Jeremy Hunt, the chancellor of the Exchequer, is expected to offer plans to promote greater work force participation.

title: Court in Italy to Rule on Convictions of 2 Americans in Police Officer’s Killing
description: The decision will either recommend a retrial or confirm the guilty verdicts against Finnegan Elder and Gabriel Natale Hjorth, who were both sentenced to more than two decades in prison.

title: Garbage Piles Up in Protest Against France’s Pension Change
description: A bill raising the retirement age for most workers by two years, to 64, is expected to become law this week, despite widespread protest, including a strike by garbage workers in Paris and elsewhere.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: The collision of a U.S. drone and a Russian fighter jet.

title: What Do Spring Festivals Look Like in Your Part of Europe?
description: We’re asking readers about spring festivals and traditions in their communities.

title: U.S. Says Russian Fighter Jet Hit American Drone Over Black Sea
description: The incident was the first known physical contact between the two militaries since the war in Ukraine began last year.
